titlestmt.titleproper: Preliminary Inventory of the Military Order of the World Wars records
Military Order of the World Wars records
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Linda Bernard

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2016-01-29T15:51-0800

did.unittitle: Military Order of the World Wars records

physdesc.extent: 341 manuscript boxes, 15 oversize boxes, 6 card file boxes, 1 oversize folder

did.abstract: Biographical data on members, chapter histories, minutes, convention proceedings, memoirs, printed matter, photographs, memorabilia, relating to American military activities, especially in World War I, World War II, the Korean War, and the Vietnamese War; and to veterans' activities.

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: Military Order of the World Wars

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Increments may have been received since this finding aid was prepared. Please check Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/ to find the full extent of the collection.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Patriotic American organization of former military officers.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Biographical data on members, chapter histories, minutes, convention proceedings, memoirs, printed matter, photographs, memorabilia, relating to American military activities, especially in World War I, World War II, the Korean War, and the Vietnamese War; and to veterans' activities.

did.unittitle: Navarre, Christopher P., Chief Warrant Officer
Who's Who forms (arranged by chapter name and therein alphabetically by Companion name).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes some chapter bulletins, histories, and rosters

did.unittitle: Baton Rouge, LA-Gen. Troy H. Middleton
Cajon Valley-San Diego (merged with General J. Paul Holland)
Central Texas Area (merged with Hill Country Texas)
Fort Buchanan (changed name to Puerto Rico)
Gulf Coast (changed name to Capt Maltby-Pensacola, then merged with Fort Walton Beach)
Honolulu (changed name to Gaylord Dillingham Memorial)
Long Beach (merged with G/A Omar N. Bradley)
Lt Richard F. Williams Memorial (merged with Santa Fe)
Oro Valley (changed name to Catalina Mountains)
Ponce, Puerto Rico (changed name to Puerto Rico)
San Juan, Puerto Rico (changed name to Puerto Rico)
Wilmington, NC (changed name to Col Bill Sheets)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes material of the first national convention in Detroit, Michigan, in 1920

did.unittitle: "A History of the Founding and First Years of the Military Order of the World Wars."
"History of the Military Order of the World Wars: ."
"History of the Military Order of the World Wars: ."
The History of the Military Order of the World Wars: Its First Fifty Years, by George C. Dyer.
The Military Order of the World Wars, A Living History: Decade of the 1970s, by Karl B. Justus.
The Military Order of the World Wars, A Living History: Decade of the 1980s, by Karl B. Justus.
Personal files of Colonel Benjamin C. Allin, III
Proceedings of national and regional conventions.
Medal of Honor recipients in MOWW
United States. Army. American Expeditionary Forces
Printed matter - Fifty Years of Military Life:
Memorabilia - Framed letter by Herbert Hoover commending the M.O.W.W. on Army Day,

Album of photographs depicting General George Armstrong Custer and his family, other officers and their wives, and Sioux chief Sitting Bull, as well as material relating to Major James M. Burns' career and personal life, and to his account of the battle of Little Big Horn,
Photograph of Brigadier General Douglas MacArthur in France during World War I
Album of photographs of military operations in the Philippines and New Guinea, , including some depicting General Douglas MacArthur
Rancho Bernardo Military Balls, San Diego
Personal files of Lieutenant Colonel Peter Burrows,
Personal files of Major Silas W. Bass, .

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes material on the Key West chapter

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes prints, slides, film strips, phonotape cassettes, and material regarding MOWW's National Bicentennial Ad Hoc Committee for the "American Freedom Train"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Catalog of items transferred to San Diego State University

did.unittitle: Annual Review, by Silas W. Bass, Jr., and William A. West, vol. 1, .
Annual Review, by William A. West, vol. 2, .
Annual Review, by William A. West, vol. 3, .
Political proclamations from Maryland state locations,
George W. Bush letters of congratulations,
MOWW staff with SINC Captain Russell Volwinkel
"The History of the Military Order of the World Wars," metal printing plates, galley proofs, and printed paper copies,
Photograph and quote from Major Ennals Guaggonner CINC,
